main.head: Mario Monti takes over from Silvio Berlusconi as Italy's PM - video
main.p: This article is more than 13 years old

Former European commissioner Mario Monti speaks of his responsibility after his appointment by Italy's president to head a new government in an effort to end a crisis that has endangered the whole eurozone. He takes over as prime minister from Silvio Berlusconi, who calls on the European Central Bank to support the euro
